name: Smoker's Lung
scientific_name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) / Pulmonary Emphysema
description: A general term describing the appearance of lungs severely damaged by long-term inhalation of tobacco smoke. It often manifests as Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD), which includes emphysema (destruction of air sacs) and chronic bronchitis (inflammation of airway lining).

early_stage.description: Mild COPD/Damage: Chronic cough and increased mucus. Lung function may be slightly reduced, but daily activities are not significantly impacted.

middle_stage.description: Moderate COPD: Shortness of breath develops during exertion. Cough becomes more persistent. Air sacs begin to lose elasticity.

advanced_stage.description: Severe COPD/Emphysema: Severe shortness of breath even at rest. Extensive destruction of alveoli leading to large air pockets (bullae). Heart complications (cor pulmonale) may arise.

causes: Primary cause is long-term exposure to tobacco smoke. The toxins in smoke destroy the cilia (cleaning hairs) and damage the elastic fibers of the alveoli.

favorable_conditions.temperature: Cold air can trigger bronchial spasms
favorable_conditions.humidity: High humidity can make breathing difficult
favorable_conditions.environment: Polluted areas or occupational exposure to dust/fumes worsen condition

impact.prevalence: COPD is the 3rd leading cause of death worldwide.
impact.socio_economic_impact: Causes significant disability, loss of productivity, and high healthcare costs due to hospitalizations.

diagnosis.laboratory_diagnosis: Chest X-ray or CT scan (to see lung damage), Arterial blood gas analysis.

susceptible_populations: Long-term smokers (both active and passive), elderly individuals, people with Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency.
life_cycle: Progressive decline in lung function over years/decades. Damage accumulates with every cigarette.
geographical_distribution: Worldwide (High in regions with high smoking rates)

dataset_metadata.intended_use: Machine learning training, research, and educational purpose
